body:
I think this will do what you want if you use `--create-empty-src-dirs`

I recall that we originally did it your way by default, but there was significant user feedback from people unhappy with this change (see https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/7689 and https://forum.rclone.org/t/how-to-ignore-empty-directories-when-uploading-from-windows/45057/9) so it was changed to require the flag.

I tend to agree that your way makes more sense and would be the natural expectation (as whether to sync directory modtimes is really a separate issue from whether to sync empty directories), and I [ranted about it here](https://forum.rclone.org/t/how-to-ignore-empty-directories-when-uploading-from-windows/45057/17?u=nielash). But backward compatibility won the day, for better or worse. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

I see. `--create-empty-src-dirs` works as expected, but to be honest I don't feel great about it. 

Both issues seem to interest backwards compatibilty with creating empty dirs, and, as I understand it, this behaivour popped up as a result. But, regardless of defaults, I really feel these should be two separate things. Suppose I want to sync modtimes but _not_ add empty dirs. Is empty dir creation so tightly coupled to modtimes that it can't be done?

It feels very weird that sync takes a `--no-update-dir-modtime` option (inherited from copy)  yet totally disregards them anyways.

At the very least, it should be added to the docs, as it's very unintuitive to expect  `--create-empty-src-dirs` to have anything to do with modtimes.

> It feels very weird that sync takes a `--no-update-dir-modtime` option (inherited from copy) yet totally disregards them anyways.

@ncw remind me... is it intended behavior that `--no-update-dir-modtime` has no effect when `--create-empty-src-dirs` is not also in use? In other words, `--no-update-dir-modtime` does not imply that dir modtimes _would_ otherwise always be updated?

It has been long enough now that I don't clearly remember what was decided (and, to @ll3006's point, the docs are quite vague on this.)

```
--no-update-dir-modtime                       Don't update directory modification times
```

Here it seems to suggest the opposite:
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/dc9c87279b989d4c9c8baec9adb259aba8b1da08/docs/content/docs.md?plain=1#L1879-L1882

@nielash 
> is it intended behavior that `--no-update-dir-modtime` has no effect when `--create-empty-src-dirs` is not also in use? In other words, `--no-update-dir-modtime` does not imply that dir modtimes _would_ otherwise always be updated?

I'd say that is a bug. I tried lots of differerent rclone versions to try to find one where this worked, but I couldn't find one.

This looks relevant 10eb4742dd9da47342ef768576fefd7c5f149443 - it looks like it was trying to fix this problem but failed.

Do you fancy having a look at what it would take to fix @nielash ?

I got as far as writing a bisect script but I couldn't find a working rclone to anchor it with!

[bisect-rclone.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18660589/bisect-rclone.zip)

> I'd say that is a bug.

I agree.

> Do you fancy having a look at what it would take to fix [@nielash](https://github.com/nielash) ?

I can, unless @ll3006 would like to have the honor?

> I can, unless @ll3006 would like to have the honor?

I am working on a prototype. I'll see if I can get it done, but I should mention I'm not overly familiar with Go.

Commit f5f86786b has the original behaviour of 'sync everything, including empty dirs'. It's also the first commit to "disrespect" `copyEmptySrcDirs`, adding directories even if they're empty. I've been working on top of this as I find it's the cleanest state before all the emptydir fixes.

Currently, my implementation idea is as follows:
- Keep a reference to all dirs that might have their modtime set (much like `setDirModTimes` does)
- If a dir is verified to be not empty (i.e. when a file from that dir is added)
    - try doing mkdir on it with metadata/modtime
    - Otherwise defer metadata/modtime for later 
- Set all deferred metadata/modtimes
- Eventually also copy empty dirs

I'll have to see if special handling is needed for dirs that have _become_ empty, that is, if all the files in a directory are deleted between two syncs. Since rclone's behaviour is to keep the directory empty, I would expect dir modtimes to also be updated in this case, if changed.

It will need extensive testing to ensure current behaviour and performance is not impacted.

Do you think this would work?

I haven't given this a close look yet and so may be wrong, but my gut says this might be overcomplicating it -- and that perhaps all that is needed is to adjust the conditional logic here:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/dc9c87279b989d4c9c8baec9adb259aba8b1da08/fs/sync/sync.go#L1114-L1129

to ensure that we call `SetDirModTime` (not `MkdirModTime`) when `!ci.NoUpdateDirModTime && !s.copyEmptySrcDirs`
Actually, yeah that seems to work. I was grossly overcomplicating it. I'll send a PR shortly

#### What is the purpose of this change?
This will make rclone sync directory mtimes by default if they've changed on the src, just like it is for files. 
This works both with and without empty directories and does _not_ change any default. 

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #8317
